head.supplied: Melbourne bot. Garden, ¶ 1 July 65. ¶ Sir ¶ ¶ I have the honor to solicit, that you will be pleased to direct, that out of the vote for purchase of plants the sum of fourty pounds Sterling (£40.-.-) ...

div.p: M65/5766, unit 103, VPRS 3991/P inward correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

I have the honor to solicit, that you will be pleased to direct, that out of the vote for purchase of plants the sum of fourty pounds Sterling (£40.-.-) may be transmitted to the Colonial Agent, London, for the payment of a consignment of plants ordered from Mr John Standish's Royal Nursery, Ascot, Berks.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: I have the honor to be,

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: your most obedient and humble servant

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p:
The honorable the Chief Secretary
Approval for M's request was annotated to this letter with the Chief Secretary’s authority number 224, and M was notified on 19 July 1865 (D1781, p. 257, unit 9, VPRS 1187/P outward correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria).
